awd_titl_txt: Analytical and Experimental Studies of Reinforced Concrete  Structures with Multicomponent Seismic Input and Various    Height-and-Width Ratios in Walls
awd_abstract_narration: A cooperative study is developed between University of Missouri and the         National Chungkung University of Taiwan to develop axial-rocking (ARR))         spectra, use the ARR spectra with other existing spectra of lateral,            verical, and lateral-torsional motion to study the effect of                    interacting ground motions on three-dimensional building systems,               conduct experimental study of the hysteretic behavior and stiffness             reduction of reinforced concrete (RC) shear walls without boundary              columns aand with various height-and-width ratios (0.5 to 3.0)                  subjected to monotonic models for predicting the inelastic behavior of          buildings systems, and study the damage of RC shear wall systems                through analysis and expermental observations.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.inst_name: Missouri University of Science and Technology
